Package hac.controllers

Class RestGameController

java.lang.Object
hac.controllers.RestGameController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/game") public class RestGameController extends Object
The controller manages the rests related to the game. Some important things about the returned error messages/ statuses: status ok: If game over, the answer is also ok and including in the body the path to game finish page. More relevant status codes: 504 error tells the user to send again request if the response is from long polling. 400 tells the user that there was an error, but he can try to send the request again and fix the error at his side. Any other type of error statuses telling the user to redirect to /lobby/error-message because There was a critical error while long polling (like some players left the room).

  • Method Details

    • getRoomStatus

      @GetMapping("/wait-to-start") public org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> getRoomStatus(Principal principal)
      A route that is doing a long polling. It handles with waiting for game to start requests. If everything is ok, it returns response status ok. The body should be empty.
      Parameters:
      principal - To extract username
      Returns:
      DeferredResult with the relevant response entity as described before.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - when there are problems/ game over.

    • updateBoard

      @PostMapping("/update") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateBoard(@RequestBody UserTurn userTurn, Principal principal)
      A route that handles with waiting new updates. If everything is ok, it returns response status ok. The body should be empty. The object that needs to send here needs to look like that: {row:___, col:___ , opponentName:___}
      Parameters:
      principal - To extract username
      userTurn - A userturn object
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the relevant response as described before.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - when there are problems/ game over.

    • test

      @GetMapping("/update/{timestamp}") public org.springframework.web.context.request.async.DeferredResult<org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>> test(@PathVariable("timestamp") int timestamp, Principal principal)
      A route that is doing a long polling. It handles with waiting for updates to start requests. Needs to receive in the path a value with the user's last index received from the updates' array. In success, a json returns, looking like that: [{attackDetails:{attackerName:___, opponentName:___, row:___, col:___}, boardChanges:[{row:___, col:___, status:"Hit"/"Miss"}, {..}, ...]}, ...] Rows and columns need to be 0 <= integer < Board.Size. attackerName is the username of the attacker, opponentName is the attacked player's username.
      Parameters:
      principal - To extract username
      Returns:
      DeferredResult with the relevant response entity as described before.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - when there are problems/ game over.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(InvalidChoiceError.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleAllExceptions(InvalidChoiceError e)
      Exception handler to handle with invalid user's choice (like problems with update)
      Parameters:
      e - the exception.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with status 400 and a body with the error message.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(GameOver.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleAllExceptions(GameOver e)
      Exception handler that handles with game over state. It tells the user to redirect to finish-page.
      Parameters:
      e - The error message (This is not a real error)
      Returns:
      response entity with status ok and body with the path to finish game.

    • handleAllExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleAllExceptions(Exception e)
      Exception handler that handles with all the exceptions in pages. It return error 500 tell the user to return /lobby/error-message path.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception
      Returns:
      Status 500 with the error message.
